title: Authors and Citation
text: Vissault S (2025). barqueReport: Tools Metabarcoding Report Generation. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {barqueReport: Tools for Metabarcoding Report Generation},   author = {Steve Vissault},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Tools for Metabarcoding Report Generation
text: can install development version barqueReport GitHub :

title: Tools for Metabarcoding Report Generation
text: main function generates interactive HTML report barque pipeline output:
code: library(barqueReport)  # Interactive file selection (recommended for beginners) generate_metabarcoding_report(   barque_output_folder = choose.dir(),  # Select barque output folder   samples_ids = c("ST1", "ST2", "ST3", "ST4"),   title = "Lake Superior Study",   subtitle = "",   author = "Steve Vissault, Julie Couillard & Tuan Ahn To",   illumina_quality_file = file.choose(),  # Select Quality_Metrics.csv file   blank_lab = "LAB_BLANK",   blank_field = "FIELD_BLANK" )  # Alternative: specify paths directly generate_metabarcoding_report(   barque_output_folder = "/path/to/barque/output",   samples_ids = c("ST1", "ST2", "ST3", "ST4"),   illumina_quality_file = "/path/to/Quality_Metrics.csv" )

title: Tools for Metabarcoding Report Generation
text: Enhance species data taxonomic conservation information: function? Fetches conservation status NatureServe Canada Retrieves common names ITIS (French English) Adds links GBIF, Catalogue Life, ITIS databases Creates formatted species names external links
code: # Load your species list species_list <- c("Salmo trutta", "Oncorhynchus mykiss", "Perca flavescens")  # Fetch comprehensive species information enhanced_species <- process_species_info(species_list)  # View the results head(enhanced_species)

title: Tools for Metabarcoding Report Generation
text: barque output folder 12_results folder produce barque. Illumina quality analysis, provide Quality_Metrics.csv file sequencer.

text: Converts Canadian province/territory codes full names using standardized lookup table.

Convert Canadian Province Codes to Full Names ‚Äî convert_province_codes
text: codes Character vector province/territory codes

title: Convert Canadian Province Codes to Full Names ‚Äî convert_province_codes
text: Character vector full province/territory names. Unknown codes return NA.

title: Convert Canadian Province Codes to Full Names ‚Äî convert_province_codes
code: convert_province_codes(c("ON", "QC", "BC")) #>                 ON                 QC                 BC  #>          "Ontario"           "Quebec" "British Columbia"  convert_province_codes(c("ON", "XX", "AB"))  # Unknown code returns NA #>        ON      <NA>        AB  #> "Ontario"        NA "Alberta"

Generate Metabarcoding Report ‚Äî generate_metabarcoding_report
text: Renders metabarcoding report using package template specified parameters.

title: Generate Metabarcoding Report ‚Äî generate_metabarcoding_report
code: generate_metabarcoding_report(   barque_output_folder,   samples_ids,   output_file = "metabarcoding_report.html",   output_dir = getwd(),   title = "üß¨ Rapport de m√©tabarcoding",   subtitle = "",   author = "",   illumina_quality_file = NULL,   blank_lab = NULL,   blank_field = NULL,   open_report = TRUE )

title: Generate Metabarcoding Report ‚Äî generate_metabarcoding_report
text: barque_output_folder Path barque output folder samples_ids Vector sample IDs include analysis output_file Output file name (default: "metabarcoding_report.html") output_dir Output directory (default: current working directory) title Report title (default: "Rapport de metabarcoding") subtitle Report subtitle (default: "") author Report author(s) (default: "") illumina_quality_file Path Illumina quality file (optional) blank_lab Laboratory blank sample ID (optional) blank_field Field blank sample ID (optional) open_report Logical, whether open report rendering (default: TRUE)

title: Generate Metabarcoding Report ‚Äî generate_metabarcoding_report
text: Path generated report file

title: Generate Metabarcoding Report ‚Äî generate_metabarcoding_report
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Basic usage  # With all parameters generate_metabarcoding_report(   barque_output_folder = "/path/to/barque/output",   samples_ids = c("ST1", "ST2", "ST3", "ST4"),   title = "Marine Biodiversity Assessment",   subtitle = "Lake Superior Study",   author = "Research Team",   output_file = "lake_superior_report.html",   blank_lab = "LAB_BLANK",   blank_field = "FIELD_BLANK" ) } # }

title: Calculate Illumina Summary Statistics ‚Äî illumina_summary_stats
text: Processes Illumina quality metrics data calculate median quality scores specified samples.

title: Calculate Illumina Summary Statistics ‚Äî illumina_summary_stats
Calculate Illumina Summary Statistics ‚Äî illumina_summary_stats
text: path Character. Path Illumina Quality_Metrics.csv file. sample_ids Character vector. Sample IDs filter analyze.

title: Calculate Illumina Summary Statistics ‚Äî illumina_summary_stats
text: data frame columns: SampleID Sample identifier mu_pf Median Mean Quality Score (PF) sample mu_q30 Median percentage Q30 bases sample

title: Calculate Illumina Summary Statistics ‚Äî illumina_summary_stats
text: function reads Illumina sequencing quality metrics calculates median values two key quality indicators: Mean Quality Score (PF): Quality score reads passing filter % Q30: Percentage bases quality score ‚â•30 (99.9% accuracy)

title: Calculate Illumina Summary Statistics ‚Äî illumina_summary_stats
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ stats <- illumina_summary_stats(   path = "path/to/Quality_Metrics.csv",   sample_ids = c("Sample1", "Sample2", "Sample3") ) } # }
